<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/onlyfans-will-ban-sexually-explicit-content-surprising-pivot?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For OnlyFans, Sex Won't Sell
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Shut it down in 30 Rock " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/yyp58Yx3Qk0TK/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47v9kg19wd5np8o8ej1ee2phx3fgo51eds3uwg6gnq&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Shut it down in 30 Rock " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/yyp58Yx3Qk0TK/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47v9kg19wd5np8o8ej1ee2phx3fgo51eds3uwg6gnq&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OnlyFans, the adult entertainment platform we <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/onlyfans-launches-sfw-app?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote about</a> earlier this week for launching a parent-approved app, made a bigger, shocking move away from porn yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting in October, it’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-19/onlyfans-to-block-sexually-explicit-videos-starting-in-october?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning users</a> from posting sexually explicit content. Creators will still be allowed to post nude photos and videos, but under new content guidelines that haven’t been released yet.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What changed? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OnlyFans said the reason for shutting down sexually explicit content was “to comply with the requests of our banking partners and payout providers,” aka it was feeling the heat from the likes of Visa and Mastercard, which don't want their services used for potentially illegal material.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Financial challenges did seem to be mounting. An Axios <a href="https://www.axios.com/onlyfans-investors-struggle-9cc92523-6607-40ad-9893-4175e7966b52.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">article</a> published just hours before the announcement revealed that OnlyFans was having trouble attracting investors because they don’t want to be associated with its adult content.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Any other company with growth like OnlyFans would be able to raise big money in a matter of minutes,” Axios’s Dan Primack wrote.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The BBC provided <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-58255865?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another perspective</a>. The news organization said that leaked documents showed that OnlyFans moderators sometimes allowed illegal content, such as child pornography, to slip by—and moderators were sometimes directed <em>not </em>to shut down successful accounts even if they broke the law. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The BBC said it approached OnlyFans with the leaked documents, implying that these allegations were linked to yesterday’s ban.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The fallout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OnlyFans will need to find itself a new content strategy, considering it just blew up the one that it relies on currently. But the impact might be most keenly felt by the <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/onlyfans-ban-pornography-sexually-explicit-1235044904/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 2 million creators</a> who have built businesses on its platform.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those creators have earned more than $5 billion since the company started in 2016, per OnlyFans.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Around 16,000 earn at least $50,000 annually, and more than 300 earn at least $1 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect other adult entertainment platforms to crop up and try to dethrone a wounded OnlyFans. Many also think the <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/19/onlyfans-porn-ban-is-cryptos-opportunity-of-a-lifetime/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crypto sector</a> could seize the opportunity, since the industry operates outside the scope of traditional payment providers. —<em> NF</em> </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/facebook-launches-vr-meeting-space-called-workrooms?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Wants You to WFM (Work From Metaverse)
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/facebook-launches-vr-meeting-space-called-workrooms?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mark Zuckerberg's avatar speaking in Workrooms" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzE3L2ZhY2Vib29rX2hvcml6b25fd29ya3Jvb21zLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Facebook</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook launched a private beta of its “Workrooms” app yesterday, which allows users to attend meetings with their coworkers in a digital shared space by using VR headsets. This is our <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/19/22629942/facebook-workrooms-horizon-oculus-vr?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first glimpse</a> at Mark Zuckerberg’s vision of the “metaverse,” or as he calls it, the “embodied internet.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What does it look like?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, it’s more like “disembodied internet” because the avatars don’t have legs, but when you <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">step foot</span> float into Workrooms, your coworkers’ avatars will join you at a virtual meeting table. Synced-up hand gestures, interactive white boards, and spatial audio help make the experience feel more realistic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Workrooms is <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-horizon-workrooms-metaverse/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one part</a> of a larger VR experience called Horizon that Facebook originally planned to launch last year. But because a true “metaverse” in the <em>Wreck-It Ralph</em> sense would involve lots of unique, interconnected experiences (Workrooms being just one), Facebook’s currently working on tools that will allow creators to help build it out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bad timing? </strong>Or maybe clever timing?<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Facebook’s announcement came right before the FTC <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/19/technology/ftc-facebook-antitrust.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refiled a lawsuit</a> yesterday alleging the company has a “monopoly” on social networking. <em>– JW</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/chip-shortages-continues-hit-global-automakers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For a Shortage, This Thing’s Lasting a Long Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Semiconductor chips disappearing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q4MKucytzKYJ4elFhG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Semiconductor chips disappearing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q4MKucytzKYJ4elFhG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The semiconductor shortage is like that bad TV show you haven’t watched in years...but somehow it’s still on the air.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week’s episode is the worst yet: Toyota said yesterday it was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/toyota-succumbs-to-chip-shortage-and-shuts-factories-11629372702?mod=hp_lead_pos6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cutting auto production</a> in Japan by 40% next month because it doesn’t have enough chips to put in its vehicles. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And because every bad episode has a few bad subplots, other automakers like GM, Ford, Stellantis, and VW said this week they’re likely cutting production soon due to the lack of chips.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The chip shortage stems from last spring, when automakers cut back on their orders during those uncertain days and failed to foresee the surge in demand for cars that would be coming just a few months later.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The chip situation was <em>supposed</em> to get better in the latter half of 2021, but the “my fall plans // the Delta variant” meme says it all. Recent Covid-19 outbreaks in Southeast Asian manufacturing hubs mean the chip shortage could hamstring auto production into 2022. <em>– NF</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Among its many indirect effects, Covid-19 has led to a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/19/business/startup-business-creation-pandemic.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">startup boom</a> in the US. The number of applications to start new businesses in the US grew 24% last year to 4.3 million, the highest on record by far. That’s helping to reverse what had been a 40-year decline in US entrepreneurship. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Anyone who has tequila right now is selling it at the price of gold.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s how one Mexican agave producer <a href="https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2021-08-17/celebrity-tequila-history-from-michael-jordan-to-the-rock?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">described</a> the tequila boom to the LA Times. And what a boom it is: Thanks to a surge in brands started by celebrities—including The Rock, Nick Jonas, and the OG tequila influencer, George Clooney—Mexico is producing 800% more tequila than it did 20 years ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>On the rise and fall of emotional support animals. (<a href="https://wesleyyang.substack.com/p/on-the-origins-of-the-emotional-support?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Year Zero</a>) </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/amazon-reportedly-planning-open-department-stores?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Goes Back to the Future
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="shopping cart with Amazon logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzE4L2FtYXpvbl9zaG9wcGluZ19jYXJ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon is like that monster from horror movies that kills its victims then assumes their identity. The company is planning to open several large brick-and-mortar retail locations in the US that resemble department stores, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-retail-department-stores-11629330842?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The physical stores will mostly sell clothing, household items, and electronics. Amazon execs hope these locations will allow them to collect even <em>more</em> data about their customers, from how long you spend comparing two smart speakers to your physical path to the register.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory</strong>: After opening its first brick-and-mortar bookstore in Seattle in 2015, Amazon has expanded its physical footprint to grocery and cashierless convenience stores. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apparel is the next category it hopes to conquer. Already, the company has surpassed Walmart to become the largest seller of clothing in the US, and it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/17/amazon-unseats-walmart-to-become-the-no-1-apparel-retailer-in-the-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped $41 billion</a> in apparel sales last year, per Wells Fargo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out</strong>: Despite being crowned a pandemic winner by virtually every pundit, Amazon’s stock hasn't reflected its recent success, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-19/amazon-s-253-billion-summer-wipeout-tests-wall-street-s-love?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tumbling nearly 14%</a> since early July. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today's Friday Puzzle is dedicated to Maki Kaji, the inventor of the Sudoku puzzle, who died this week at 69. Thank you for bringing the joy of puzzles to the world, Mr. Kaji. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">See if you can solve this Sudoku-type game: </strong>Fill the grid with the numbers from 1 to 4 such that no number appears more than once in each row or column, and that the numbers in each of the two regions add to the same sum.</p>
<figure id="edd3eaa3-e6e8-44e3-966b-02f90eb3b4da" class="dcr-10khgmf"></figure>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> </small></p>

href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/onlyfans-launches-sfw-app?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote about\u003c/a\u003e earlier this week for launching a parent-approved app, made a bigger, shocking move away from porn yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarting in October, it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-19/onlyfans-to-block-sexually-explicit-videos-starting-in-october?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanning users\u003c/a\u003e from posting sexually explicit content. Creators will still be allowed to post nude photos and videos, but under new content guidelines that haven’t been released yet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat changed? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnlyFans said the reason for shutting down sexually explicit content was “to comply with the requests of our banking partners and payout providers,” aka it was feeling the heat from the likes of Visa and Mastercard, which don't want their services used for potentially illegal material.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFinancial challenges did seem to be mounting. An Axios \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/onlyfans-investors-struggle-9cc92523-6607-40ad-9893-4175e7966b52.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earticle\u003c/a\u003e published just hours before the announcement revealed that OnlyFans was having trouble attracting investors because they don’t want to be associated with its adult content.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Any other company with growth like OnlyFans would be able to raise big money in a matter of minutes,” Axios’s Dan Primack wrote.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe BBC provided \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-58255865?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanother perspective\u003c/a\u003e. The news organization said that leaked documents showed that OnlyFans moderators sometimes allowed illegal content, such as child pornography, to slip by—and moderators were sometimes directed \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003eto shut down successful accounts even if they broke the law. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe BBC said it approached OnlyFans with the leaked documents, implying that these allegations were linked to yesterday’s ban.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe fallout\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnlyFans will need to find itself a new content strategy, considering it just blew up the one that it relies on currently. But the impact might be most keenly felt by the \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/onlyfans-ban-pornography-sexually-explicit-1235044904/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 2 million creators\u003c/a\u003e who have built businesses on its platform.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose creators have earned more than $5 billion since the company started in 2016, per OnlyFans.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAround 16,000 earn at least $50,000 annually, and more than 300 earn at least $1 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eexpect other adult entertainment platforms to crop up and try to dethrone a wounded OnlyFans. Many also think the \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/19/onlyfans-porn-ban-is-cryptos-opportunity-of-a-lifetime/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrypto sector\u003c/a\u003e could seize the opportunity, since the industry operates outside the scope of traditional payment providers. —\u003cem\u003e NF\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook launched a private beta of its “Workrooms” app yesterday, which allows users to attend meetings with their coworkers in a digital shared space by using VR headsets. This is our \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/19/22629942/facebook-workrooms-horizon-oculus-vr?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst glimpse\u003c/a\u003e at Mark Zuckerberg’s vision of the “metaverse,” or as he calls it, the “embodied internet.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat does it look like?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, it’s more like “disembodied internet” because the avatars don’t have legs, but when you \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003estep foot\u003c/span\u003e float into Workrooms, your coworkers’ avatars will join you at a virtual meeting table. Synced-up hand gestures, interactive white boards, and spatial audio help make the experience feel more realistic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Workrooms is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/facebook-horizon-workrooms-metaverse/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone part\u003c/a\u003e of a larger VR experience called Horizon that Facebook originally planned to launch last year. But because a true “metaverse” in the \u003cem\u003eWreck-It Ralph\u003c/em\u003e sense would involve lots of unique, interconnected experiences (Workrooms being just one), Facebook’s currently working on tools that will allow creators to help build it out.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBad timing? \u003c/strong\u003eOr maybe clever timing?\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eFacebook’s announcement came right before the FTC \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/19/technology/ftc-facebook-antitrust.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erefiled a lawsuit\u003c/a\u003e yesterday alleging the company has a “monopoly” on social networking. \u003cem\u003e– collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe semiconductor shortage is like that bad TV show you haven’t watched in years...but somehow it’s still on the air.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week’s episode is the worst yet: Toyota said yesterday it was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/toyota-succumbs-to-chip-shortage-and-shuts-factories-11629372702?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecutting auto production\u003c/a\u003e in Japan by 40% next month because it doesn’t have enough chips to put in its vehicles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd because every bad episode has a few bad subplots, other automakers like GM, Ford, Stellantis, and VW said this week they’re likely cutting production soon due to the lack of chips.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe chip shortage stems from last spring, when automakers cut back on their orders during those uncertain days and failed to foresee the surge in demand for cars that would be coming just a few months later.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe chip situation was \u003cem\u003esupposed\u003c/em\u003e to get better in the latter half of 2021, but the “my fall plans // the Delta variant” meme says it all. Recent Covid-19 outbreaks in Southeast Asian manufacturing hubs mean the chip shortage could hamstring auto production into 2022. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL Amazon execs hope these locations will allow them to collect even \u003cem\u003emore\u003c/em\u003e data about their customers, from how long you spend comparing two smart speakers to your physical path to the register.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/strong\u003e: After opening its first brick-and-mortar bookstore in Seattle in 2015, Amazon has expanded its physical footprint to grocery and cashierless convenience stores. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApparel is the next category it hopes to conquer. Already, the company has surpassed Walmart to become the largest seller of clothing in the US, and it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/17/amazon-unseats-walmart-to-become-the-no-1-apparel-retailer-in-the-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped $41 billion\u003c/a\u003e in apparel sales last year, per Wells Fargo. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out\u003c/strong\u003e: Despite being crowned a pandemic winner by virtually every pundit,
